## Introducción

Este curso está diseñado para estudiantes y profesionales en áreas relacionadas con la Ecología, Conservación y Manejo de Recursos, entre otras disciplinas afines.

El propósito principal de este curso es servir como una guía que permita a los estudiantes desarrollar, interpretar e implementar técnicas de análisis de datos centradas en la Ecología de Poblaciones.

#### Articulos

N-Mixture [Evaluating Golden-winged Warbler use of alder and aspen communities managed with shearing in the western Great Lakes](https://doi.org/10.1002/ecs2.4443)

Ocupancion [Using aerial LiDAR to assess regional availability of potential habitat for a conservation dependent forest bird](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.foreco.2023.121002)

#### Paquetes en R

[unmarked: An R Package for Fitting Hierarchical Models of Wildlife Occurrence and Abundance](https://doi.org/10.18637/jss.v043.i10)

[The unmarked R package: Twelve years of advances in occurrence and abundance modelling in ecology]( https://doi.org/10.1111/2041-210X.14123)

[spAbundance: An R package for single-species and multi-species spatially explicit abundance models](https://doi.org/10.1111/2041-210X.14332)

[spOccupancy: An R package for single-species, multi-species, and integrated spatial occupancy models](https://doi.org/10.1111/2041-210X.13897)

[ubms: An R package for fitting hierarchical occupancy and N-mixture abundance models in a Bayesian framework](https://doi.org/10.1111/2041-210X.13777)
